item.title: Logging: Access
item.description:
An Access is a set of credentials and configuration in order to access the system of a Supplier. GraphQL schema definition <li> <span class="tab"> code: ID! <li> <span class="tab"> accessData: AccessData <li> <span class="tab"> error: [Error!] <li> <span class="tab"> createdAt: DateTime! <li> <span class="tab"> updatedAt: DateTime! <li class="deprecated-button-container p-2"> <button class="btn btn-sm btn-info ml-5" onclick="toggleDeprecatedEntitiesContainer(this)">Show deprecated fields</button> </li> <div class="deprecated-entities-container"> </div> <li>}</li> </ul> Fields <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/accessdata">accessData(AccessData):</a> <span class="description"></span> </li> <li class="lifields"> <a href="/stats/reference/objects/error">error([Error!
[...]

item.title: Logging: Member
item.description:
You grant access to members which can be either: Users: A developer, administrator or any other person from your Organization who interacts with the TravelgateX Platform. An email address can be used as the identity of a User. Service Accounts: An application (Client) instead of an individual User. If you prefer, you can create as many Service Accounts as needed to represent different logical components of your application. GraphQL schema definition <li> <span class="tab"> code: ID!
[...]

item.title: Logging: Organization
item.description:
Organization node is the root node in the hierarachy, the folders are the children of the organization and the products are the children of the folders. [...]
